intro: Polyalthia intermedia, commonly known as the Khasi flame tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its striking, fiery red flowers that bloom in clusters during the rainy season. The plant has compound leaves with elongated leaflets and produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated in gardens and parks in tropical and subtropical regions.
